Articles.Content:
KSP: 1.12.2

Problem: While a kerbal is on EVA and freefalling in the air (tested on Kerbin, lack of atmosphere is not the cause), pressing P or using the right-click menu to deploy the parachute causes the kerbal to spread their arms as if the parachute is deployed, and the menu option changes to "cut parachute" however the parachute never actually deploys nor does the kerbal slow down at all.

Mod list:

CKAN:

Animated Decouplers (AnimatedDecouplers v1.5.0)
ASET Agency (ASETAgency 1.0)
ASET Props (ASETProps 1.5)
Blast Awesomeness Modifier (BAM) (BAMCont 1.3.3.4)
Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - Next (KerbalJointReinforcementNext v4.1.15)
MechJeb 2 (MechJeb2 2.12.3.0)
Module Manager (ModuleManager 4.2.1)
Physics Range Extender  (PhysicsRangeExtender 1.21.0)
RasterPropMonitor Core (RasterPropMonitor-Core 1:v0.31.6)
TextureReplacer (TextureReplacer v4.5.2)

Manual install:

BDArmory for Runway Project

DarkMultiPlayer

kOS

VesselMover

Steps to reproduce issue:

1. Get a kerbal into the air, either by spawning a flying vehicle or by yeetenizing one into the air with VesselMover

2. Try to deploy the personal parachute of the kerbal.

3. Splat. 

Logfile:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-hEmisQcDE5JS-gMGYvuLwu36uuXWNCw/view?usp=sharing

 

As an aside, it's been a couple of years since I last posted on these forums, so please let me know if I'm missing any vital information that could lead to the solving of this issue

Edited January 15, 2022 by Aspacedog
updated the logfile link, didn't realise the previous one was single use
I'm sharing a past stupid thing I did that may or may not help you: I forgot that level 0 Kerbals don't know how to parachute in career mode.
